course_title: Spec Stud:19th/20th Cent Art: Helen Frankenthaler/Her Legacy
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 22Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Complete Topic: Helen Frankenthaler and Her Legacies)
(This course examines both Helen Frankenthaler's influences and those she influenced. As a painter who was keenly aware of the history of art, her sources ranged from Jackson Pollock to Persian miniatures. Frankenthaler also shaped artistic production from the 1960s to the present; feminist artists in particular have developed an enduring (and sometimes strained) relationship with her work. Throughout the class, we will be concerned with contemporary issues in art history, including class consciousness, feminism, gender norms, and Frankenthaler's place in an increasingly global narrative of abstraction.)
(Art History major/minor: Division III)
course_description: Possible topics include Post-Impressionism and its consequences; Matisse & Picasso; Art and Politics between the Wars; Dada and Surrealism; the Avant-Garde; Abstract Art; What is Art?; Theories of Modernism. May be repeated for credit when topic changes, up to a maximum of twelve hours.
